sub_title: Deputy Director, Global Climate Litigation, Our Children's Trust
summary: I am a human rights lawyer with over 20 years of experience. After graduating from the University of Oregon School of Law in 1999 I began my career working at the intersection of environment and human rights in Tanzania with Lawyers' Environmental Action Team. Upon returning from East Africa, I worked to protect the landscapes of the western U.S. from fossil fuel development. I then took a break from law to pursue an M.F.A. in Science and Natural History Filmmaking from Montana State University. This is how I met Our Children’s Trust. In 2010 while leading the North American program for the international human rights organization, WITNESS, I partnered with Our Children's Trust to create a ten-part film series, "Stories of TRUST". This series elevated the voices of our youth plaintiffs. Once this partnership came to an end, I stepped onto the Board of Our Children's Trust while traveling the world teaching communities how to use video to document grave international crimes and devastating human and environmental rights violations. I now head up the global work at Our Children’s Trust. In my off time, I can be found with my dogs, Tingo and Charley, rowing or paddle boarding around the canals of Amsterdam or biking the tens of thousands of kilometers of bike paths throughout Europe.

profile_positions.description:
Aug. 2013 – Apr. 2022
Associate Director and Senior Attorney: Launched and led WITNESS’ Video as Evidence Program. Collaborated with criminal justice experts, human rights investigators, public interest lawyers and frontline activists from across the globe to develop guidance to enhance the evidentiary value of video captured in the field. Trained frontline human rights attorneys and activists on this guidance. In turn, supported these advocates to strategically use video in justice and accountability processes. Focus areas are Syria, Ukraine, Brazil, Ecuador, Peru, Republic of Guinea and the Democratic Republic of Congo. 

Nov. 2008 – Jul. 2013
Senior Program Manager for the Americas: Identify emerging human rights issues that would benefit from the strategic use of video. Propose projects and develop collaborations with organizations and networks specializing in these issues. Work with collaborators guiding them through the pre-production, production, post-production, strategic distribution, media outreach and monitoring stages of a full-fledged human rights campaign. 

Nov. 2006 – Dec. 2007
Video Advocacy Institute Coordinator: Launched the inaugural Video Advocacy Institute (VAI) in collaboration with Concordia University’s Journalism and Communications Department. The VAI was an intensive two-week program that trained human rights advocates from around the world to integrate video into their human rights campaigns.
profile_positions.title: Associate Director and Senior Attorney, Video as Evidence Program

profile_positions.description: Researched video’s capacity to increase knowledge, change attitudes and, in turn, influence behavior in remote communities in northern Congo. In the field, worked with a team of Congolese outreach education specialists who traveled from village-to-village with a mobile projection system bringing communities films about how to prevent contracting and transmitting the Ebola virus. Completed an in-depth case study of this video-outreach model and directed and produced the documentary film Never Wash Away.
profile_positions.title: Research Scholar with the Central African Regional Program for the Environment

profile_positions.description: Led the public lands conservation efforts throughout the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. Brought administrative appeals in the areas of oil and gas leasing and development, roads and highways, wildlife, clean air and visibility, timber sales and land exchanges. Litigated cases primarily with respect to oil and gas leasing and development.
profile_positions.title: Staff Attorney, Greater Yellowstone Program

profile_positions.description: Researched and drafted legal memoranda and orders in a variety of civil and criminal cases. Issues primarily involved constitutional, evidentiary, family, tort and property law questions.
profile_positions.title: Judicial Law Clerk

profile_positions.description: Researched, wrote and published, A Brief Survey of Standing: Seeking Shelter without Technicalities in Africa, examining a citizen’s right to bring litigation against their own government when the government breaks its own constitutional promises or laws. Edited an attorney paper on indigenous and wildlife rights. Advanced grant proposals with U.S. and African foundations. Lectured at the University of Dar es Salaam.
